DOC.brief_title: Preemptive Use Nicotine Patch Postoperative Pain Relief After Open Abdominal Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Study patient include nonsmoker age 18-75 undergoing open abdominal wall surgery general anesthesia . If patient smoke , receive regional anesthetic epidural , pregnant , he/she exclude study . There two randomize study group . Group B receive seven-milligram transdermal patch Group A receive placebo patch . Generic seven-milligram nicotine patch identical placebo patch make band-aids glue 3x4 inch adhesive pad place individual ' right upper arm 1 hour surgery . All patient give standardized anesthetic consist narcotic infusion , propofol , neuromuscular blocking agent , anesthetic gas agent , antinauseant medication nonsteroidal . Patients receive postoperative analgesia twenty four hour surgery narcotic additional nonsteroidal medication . All patient receive intravenous control patient control analgesia ( IVPCA ) morphine sulfate one milligram per ten minute , forty milligram four hour limit . Patients also receive toradol fifteen milligram breakthrough pain . The patch remove participant twenty four hour post IVPCA initiation . The following item assess every four hour twenty four hour post anesthesia care unit discharge : verbal rating pain , total IVPCA morphine use , nausea occurrence , vomit occurrence , sedation score nurse .
